title: Staple cartridge comprising a variable thickness compressible portion
abstract: A fastener cartridge can comprise a support portion, a tissue thickness compensator positioned relative to the support portion, and a plurality of fasteners positioned within the support portion and/or the tissue thickness compensator which can be utilized to fasten tissue. In use, the fastener cartridge can be positioned in a first jaw of a surgical fastening device, wherein a second jaw, or anvil, can be positioned opposite the first jaw. To deploy the fasteners, a staple-deploying member is advanced through the fastener cartridge to move the fasteners toward the anvil. As the fasteners are deployed, the fasteners can capture at least a portion of the tissue thickness compensator therein along with at least a portion of the tissue being fastened.
claims:
1. A surgical stapling assembly, comprising:
a first jaw;
a second jaw movable relative to said first jaw;
a staple cartridge, comprising:
a cartridge body, comprising:
a deck;
a longitudinal slot defined in said deck, wherein said longitudinal slot is configured to receive a firing member therethrough;
a first row of staple cavities defined in said deck, wherein said first row of staple cavities is positioned a first distance from said longitudinal slot; and
a second row of staple cavities defined in said deck, wherein said second row of staple cavities is positioned a second distance from said longitudinal slot, wherein said second distance is greater than said first distance; and
a plurality of staples removably stored in said first row of staple cavities and said second row of staple cavities, wherein said plurality of staples are configured to be progressively deployed from said staple cartridge by the firing member;
an implantable layer, comprising:
a tissue-contacting surface comprising a curved cross-sectional profile; and
a body portion, wherein said body portion comprises a height varying laterally along a lateral width of said body portion defining:
a first tissue gap defined between said tissue-contacting surface and one of said first jaw and said second jaw, wherein said first tissue gap is aligned with said first row of staple cavities; and
a second tissue gap defined between said tissue-contacting surface and said one of said first jaw and said second jaw, wherein said second tissue gap is aligned with said second row of staple cavities, and wherein said first tissue gap is different than said second tissue gap,
wherein said curved cross-sectional profile defines a plurality of slopes along a width of said implantable layer, and wherein said curved cross-sectional profile defines a variation in thickness of said implantable layer along said width.
2. The surgical stapling assembly of claim 1, wherein said implantable layer further comprises a first thickness corresponding to said first tissue gap and a second thickness corresponding to said second tissue gap, wherein said first thickness and said second thickness are different.
3. A surgical staple cartridge assembly for use with a surgical stapling assembly, wherein the surgical stapling assembly is configured to clamp, staple, and cut tissue positioned between a first jaw and a second jaw of the surgical stapling assembly, wherein said surgical staple cartridge assembly comprises:
a staple cartridge, comprising:
a cartridge body, comprising:
a deck;
a longitudinal slot defined in said deck, wherein said longitudinal slot is configured to receive a firing member therethrough;
a first row of staple cavities defined in said deck, wherein said first row of staple cavities is positioned a first distance from said longitudinal slot; and
a second row of staple cavities defined in said deck, wherein said second row of staple cavities is positioned a second distance from said longitudinal slot, wherein said second distance is greater than said first distance; and
a plurality of staples removably stored in said first row of staple cavities and said second row of staple cavities, wherein said plurality of staples are configured to be progressively ejected from said staple cartridge by the firing member; and
an implantable layer, comprising:
a tissue-contacting surface comprising a stepped cross-sectional profile; and
a body portion, wherein said body portion comprises a thickness varying laterally along a lateral width of said body portion defining:
a first tissue gap defined between said tissue-contacting surface and an opposing surface of one of the first jaw and the second jaw, wherein said first tissue gap is aligned with said first row of staple cavities; and
a second tissue gap defined between said tissue-contacting surface and the one of the first jaw and the second jaw, wherein said second tissue gap is aligned with said second row of staple cavities, and wherein said first tissue gap is different than said second tissue gap,
wherein said stepped cross-sectional profile defines a first thickness of said layer corresponding to said first tissue gap and a second thickness of said layer corresponding to said second tissue gap, and wherein said first thickness and said second thickness are different.
4. A surgical staple cartridge assembly for use with a surgical stapling assembly, wherein the surgical stapling assembly is configured to clamp, staple, and cut tissue positioned between a first jaw and a second jaw of the surgical stapling assembly, wherein said surgical staple cartridge assembly comprises:
a staple cartridge, comprising:
a cartridge body, comprising:
a deck;
a longitudinal slot defined in said deck, wherein said longitudinal slot is configured to receive a firing member therethrough;
a first row of staples positioned a first distance from said longitudinal slot; and
a second row of staples positioned a second distance from said longitudinal slot, wherein said second distance is greater than said first distance; and
an implantable layer, comprising:
a tissue-contacting surface comprising a curved cross-sectional profile; and
a body portion, wherein said body portion comprises a laterally-varying thickness profile defining:
a first tissue gap distance defined between said tissue-contacting surface and an opposing surface of one of the first jaw and the second jaw, wherein said first tissue gap distance is aligned with said first row of staples; and
a second tissue gap distance defined between said tissue-contacting surface and the one of the first jaw and the second jaw, wherein said second tissue gap distance is aligned with said second row of staples, and wherein said first tissue gap distance is different than said second tissue gap distance,
wherein said curved cross-sectional profile defines a plurality of slopes along a width of said implantable layer, and wherein said curved cross-sectional profile defines a variation in thickness of said implantable layer along said width.
5. The surgical staple cartridge assembly of claim 4, wherein said implantable layer further comprises a first thickness corresponding to said first tissue gap and a second thickness corresponding to said second tissue gap, wherein said first thickness and said second thickness are different.
6. A staple cartridge assembly for use with a surgical stapling instrument, wherein the surgical stapling instrument is configured to clamp, staple, and cut tissue positioned between a first jaw and a second jaw of the surgical stapling instrument, wherein said staple cartridge assembly comprises:
a cartridge body, comprising:
a deck;
a longitudinal slot defined in said deck, wherein said longitudinal slot is configured to receive a firing member of the surgical stapling instrument therein;
a first longitudinal row of staple cavities defined in said deck, wherein said first longitudinal row of staple cavities is positioned a first distance from said longitudinal slot; and
a second longitudinal row of staple cavities defined in said deck, wherein said second longitudinal row of staple cavities is positioned a second distance from said longitudinal slot, wherein said second distance is greater than said first distance; and
staples removably stored in said first longitudinal row of staple cavities and said second longitudinal row of staple cavities, wherein said staples are arranged so as to be progressively ejected from said first and second longitudinal rows of staple cavities by the firing member during a staple firing stroke; and
an implantable layer, comprising:
a tissue-contacting surface comprising a stepped cross-sectional profile; and
a body portion, wherein said body portion comprises a thickness varying laterally along a lateral width of said body portion defining:
a first lateral portion aligned with said first longitudinal row of staple cavities that defines a first tissue gap between said tissue-contacting surface and an opposing surface of the first jaw; and
a second lateral portion aligned with said second row of staple cavities that defines a second tissue gap between said tissue-contacting surface and an opposing surface of the first jaw, wherein said first tissue gap is different than said second tissue gap, wherein said stepped cross-sectional profile defines a first thickness of said layer corresponding to said first tissue gap and a second thickness of said layer corresponding to said second tissue gap, and wherein said first thickness and said second thickness are different.
7. A staple cartridge assembly for use with a surgical stapling instrument, wherein the surgical stapling instrument is configured to clamp, staple, and cut tissue positioned between a first jaw and a second jaw of the surgical stapling instrument, wherein said staple cartridge assembly comprises:
a cartridge body, comprising:
a deck;
a longitudinal slot defined in said deck, wherein said longitudinal slot is configured to receive a firing member of the surgical stapling instrument therein;
a first longitudinal row of staple cavities defined in said deck, wherein said first longitudinal row of staple cavities is positioned a first distance from said longitudinal slot; and
a second longitudinal row of staple cavities defined in said deck, wherein said second longitudinal row of staple cavities is positioned a second distance from said longitudinal slot, wherein said second distance is greater than said first distance; and
staples removably stored in said first longitudinal row of staple cavities and said second longitudinal row of staple cavities, wherein said staples are arranged so as to be progressively ejected from said first and second longitudinal rows of staple cavities by the firing member during a staple firing stroke; and
an implantable layer, comprising:
a tissue-contacting surface comprising a curved cross-sectional profile; and
a body portion, wherein said body portion comprises a thickness varying laterally along a lateral width of said body portion defining:
a first lateral portion aligned with said first longitudinal row of staple cavities that defines a first tissue gap between said tissue-contacting surface and an opposing surface of the first jaw; and
a second lateral portion aligned with said second row of staple cavities that defines a second tissue gap between said tissue-contacting surface and an opposing surface of the first jaw, wherein said first tissue gap is different than said second tissue gap, wherein said curved cross-sectional profile defines a plurality of slopes along a width of said implantable layer, and wherein said curved cross-sectional profile defines a variation in thickness of said implantable layer along said width.
